item.title: Navy Civil Engineer Corps Officer Seminar
item.description: Friday, February 28, 2025 12:15 PM - 1:15 PM - Engineers and Architects – are you interested in serving your country in the U.S. Navy Civil Engineer Corps? Learn how you can be a SeaBee and practice expeditionary project management, design, planning, contracting, and more! Salary and other benefits are available to undergraduates. Join us in DCC 318.

item.title: Countdown to Commencement Celebration - February 26
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 11:00 AM - 5:00 PM - The Countdown to Commencement celebrates graduating students and prepares them for commencement and their transition into becoming alumni of Rensselaer. Attendees will be able to learn important information about commencement, purchase their cap and gown, learn about end-of-semester events, and much more. The event is open to all students graduating in May 2025.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Hosts Mechanical Engineering Review - February 26
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work faculty for a 30-minute information session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one’s career takes them. Register online here.

item.title: BSA Fashion Show
item.description: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 6:00 pm - This year, the RPI Black Students’ Alliance Fashion Show is presented in partnership with EMPAC Research and PULSE, the RPI student group exploring electronic dance music. In a world overflowing with fast-fashion, this show asks, How can experimental and multisensory media drive progress toward eco-futurism? Student visions merge with custom couture and bleeding-edge research to showcase our collective creativity. Presented by EMPAC Research Performance

item.title: STS Colloquium with Veronica Aguila to be held on February 26
item.description: STS invites you to join Veronica Aguila’s colloquium on February 26 from 11:30am-1pm in Sage 5711. Unlike software designers, Internet of Things designers must negotiate global supply chains to realize their visions. By bringing a case study from open hardware design in Mexico, Dr. Aguila shows how technology trade policies—and trade policy in general—have shaped and will continue to shape computing designs and design practices (hardware, firmware, and software).

item.description: Join us for the Meet Your Faculty Senate Musical Salon on Wednesday, February 26, 2025, from 4:00 to 6:00 PM in the Russell Sage Dining Hall! item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Listening in a Hectic World”-Part 1
item.description:
Listening is a vehicle to get the information needed to accomplish work objectives. In today’s information-saturated work environment, everyone needs to be able to tune out the “noise” and tune in to what’s important. In this seminar, we explore a listening approach that balances the demands of getting the information that you need with the awareness that every interaction provides an opportunity to cement solid work relationships with others.
